title: Curb Ramps
description: Curb ramp locations and attribute data. These data come from the Curb Ramp Information System (CRIS). Please be advised – CRIS is a planning tool only. There is no guarantee of attribute accuracy. Also, while the data syncs nightly the underlying system only updates about once a quarter.

columns.name: locID
columns.description: Primary key composed of CNN+CurbReturnLoc+PositionOnReturn ('XX' if unknown)+ CurbType

columns.name: CNN
columns.description: Intersection CNN of this curb ramp

columns.name: xLoc
columns.description: X coordinate (CA State Plane III)

columns.name: yLoc
columns.description: Y coordinate(CA State Plane III)

columns.name: LocationDescription
columns.description: Name of intersection, cross streets

columns.name: curbReturnLoc
columns.description: Direction of the curb return (NW, N, NE, E, SE, S, SW, W)

columns.name: positionOnReturn
columns.description: Position of the curb ramp on the return (Left, Center, Right, Mid‐Block, In‐Bound, Out‐Bound, Unknown)

columns.name: Latitude
columns.description: Latitude (WGS84)

columns.name: Longitude
columns.description: Longitude (WGS84)

columns.name: LastUpdate
columns.description: date record was last updated or added to dataset

columns.name: InvenID
columns.description: Legacy primary key for curb ramp locations

columns.name: conditionScore
columns.description: Condition score The condition scores are as follows: 1‐100 an existing ramp is rated from where 1 is worst and 100 is best. 0 = no current curb ramp, but needed ‐1 = It’s possible to build a ramp, but not needed ‐2 = no existing ramp, and not needed (no legal or safe crossing or not possible)

columns.name: detectableSurf
columns.description: Does the ramp have a detectable surface? 1= compliant, 0 or null then deduction of 5 points

columns.name: vitalFacilities
columns.description: Is the path of travel critical for citizen access to vital facilities?

columns.name: heavyTraffic
columns.description: Is a curb ramp needed to preserve the path of travel in a heavy traffic area?

columns.name: lipTooHigh
columns.description: Is the lip too high? 0 = compliant, 1 or null then deduction of 5 points

columns.name: probStreetMeetCR
columns.description: Is there a problem with how the street meets the curb ramp?

columns.name: possBasementObstacle
columns.description: Is there a possible basement obstacle to building a new curb ramp?

columns.name: signalPoleInWing
columns.description: Are there poles or hydrants in the curb ramp wing within 6" of the ramp? 0 = compliant, 1 or null then deduction of 2 points

columns.name: catchBasinFrontOfCR
columns.description: Is the catch basin in the landing area in front of the curb ramp? 0 = compliant, 1 or null then deduction of 20 points

columns.name: insideCrosswalk
columns.description: Is the curb ramp inside the path of travel/crosswalk? 1 = compliant, 0 or null then deduction point taken

columns.name: surfCond
columns.description: Is the surface condition acceptable? 1 = compliant, 0 or null then deduction of 5 points

columns.name: slopeWing
columns.description: Is the slope of the sides of the ramp (i.e., the wings) less than 10%? 1 = compliant, 0 or null then deduction of 2 points

columns.name: flushToCorner
columns.description: Is the curb ramp flush to the corner?

columns.name: colorContrast
columns.description: Is there color contrast concentrate to indicate the curb ramp? 1 = compliant, 0 or null then deduction of 2 points

columns.name: paintedRed
columns.description: Is the curb ramp painted red? (not currently used)

columns.name: topClearance
columns.description: Is the top clearance of the curb ramp acceptable? (not currently used)

columns.name: sideClearance
columns.description: Is the side clearance of the curb ramp acceptable? (not currently used)

columns.name: CRTooNarrow
columns.description: Is the curb ramp width acceptable? ? 1 = compliant, 0 or null then deduction of 2 points

columns.name: levelLandTop
columns.description: Is there a clear, level landing at the top of the ramp? 1 = compliant, 0 or null then deduction of 8 points

columns.name: levelLandBottom
columns.description: Is there a clear, level landing at the bottom of the ramp? 1 = compliant, 0 or null then deduction of 13 points

columns.name: slopeRangeID
columns.description: Integer primary key for slope range 1 = <6.67%, 2 = 6.67‐8.33%, 3 = 8.33 ‐10% (deduct 12 points), 4 = >10% (deduct 25 points), 5 = unknown

columns.name: crPossible
columns.description: char(3) primary key for codes denoting reason for ramp non‐existence

columns.name: crExist
columns.description: Reason for ramp construction possibility or impossibility

columns.name: Location
columns.description: Represents vector geometry objects on a map
